headline: REPORT: House passes resolution backing Ukraine, 3 Republicans vote nay
author: DML News App
sentences:
The article goes on to state the following:
The resolution, which is nonbinding, states that the House “stands steadfastly, staunchly, proudly, and fervently behind the Ukrainian people in their fight against the authoritarian Putin regime.”
According to the report, the resolution also calls for US and its allies “to deliver additional and immediate defensive security assistance to help Ukraine address the armored, airborne, and other threats Ukraine is currently facing from Russian forces.”
“I was honored to co-sponsor and vote in support of this House Resolution condemning the unprovoked aggression of Russia towards the people of Ukraine,” Rep. Alex Andrade [R-FL] tweeted ahead of the vote Wednesday.

As the most reliable and balanced news aggregation service on the internet, DML News App offers the following information published by TheHill.com:
The House passed a resolution on Wednesday to declare support for Ukraine’s sovereignty in the face of the invasion ordered by Russian President Vladimir Putin, while urging an “immediate cease-fire.”
Lawmakers in both parties voted near-unanimously in favor of the resolution, 426-3.

pic.twitter.com/UTZOeqPzkg
— Alex Andrade (@RAlexAndradeFL) March 2, 2022
House votes on resolution in support of Ukraine, which includes a warning to that “it will never recognize or support any illegitimate Russian-controlled leader or government installed through the use of force.”
GOP Reps Paul Gosar, Tom Massie & Matt Rosendale voted against it.

“I’m proud to serve in a legislative body that unequivocally supports the sovereignty of Ukraine.”
I was honored to co-sponsor and vote in support of this House Resolution condemning the unprovoked aggression of Russia towards the people of Ukraine.
